data.title: Disney Channel Omits Demi Lovato From Anniversary Montage
data.meta_description: Fans have labeled the Disney Channel ‚Äúdisrespectful‚Äù after noticing that several tweets referring to Demi‚Äôs harrowing experiences during her teenage years had been hidden from public view. Note: This article contains mention of rape, drug abuse, and eating disorders.
data.text:
The Disney Channel Is Facing Backlash For Seemingly Hiding Comments About Demi Lovato‚Äôs Claim That A Fellow Disney Alum Raped Her When She Was A Teenager

Fans have labeled the Disney Channel ‚Äúdisrespectful‚Äù after noticing that several tweets referring to Demi‚Äôs harrowing experiences during her teenage years had been hidden from public view. Note: This article contains mention of rape, drug abuse, and eating disorders.

Hot Topic

üî• Full coverage and conversation on Disney

On April 1, the Disney Channel posted a compilation of several former Disney stars‚Äô most iconic ‚Äúwand IDs‚Äù ‚Äî aka the outlining of Mickey Mouse‚Äôs ears with a wand ‚Äî in honor of its 40th anniversary.

The celebrities featured in the montage included the likes of Selena Gomez (Wizards of Waverly Place), Miley Cyrus (Hannah Montana), Raven Symone (That‚Äôs So Raven), the Jonas Brothers (Jonas), and so many more.

But one very notable Disney star who wasn‚Äôt included in the roundup was Demi Lovato.

Demi, who uses she/her and they/them pronouns, is easily one of the most famous former Disney actors. She appeared in a range of the network‚Äôs original series from the age of 15, including As The Bell Rings, Sonny With A Chance, and So Random, as well as several movies, such as Camp Rock and Camp Rock 2: The Final Jam alongside the Jonas Brothers, and Princess Protection Programme with Selena Gomez.

BuzzFeed TrendingHot Topic

Obsessed with all things Disney? Join our fan community where you'll find hot topic discussions, quizzes, movie news, and more!

See our Disney Discussions

And so, fans were pretty baffled to see that Demi wasn‚Äôt included in the Disney Channel‚Äôs 40th anniversary montage.

Well, it wasn‚Äôt long before people started theorizing that Demi‚Äôs public comments about her negative experiences on Disney might‚Äôve influenced the network‚Äôs decision to omit her from their tribute.

For context, Demi has long been vocal about how their time at Disney was blighted by their struggle with eating disorders, drug addiction, and an alleged rape that took place in the late 2000s.

In her 2021 docuseries, Demi Lovato: Dancing With the Devil, Demi claimed she was raped by someone else from the Disney circle when she was a teenager. She did not disclose the person‚Äôs identity.

‚ÄúWe were hooking up but I said, ‚ÄòHey, this is not going any farther. I‚Äôm a virgin, and I don‚Äôt want to lose it this way.‚Äô And that didn‚Äôt matter to them, they did it anyways,‚Äù Demi said.

‚ÄúI internalized it and I told myself it was my fault, because I still went in the room with him. I still hooked up with him,‚Äù she continued.

‚ÄúThe Christian, Southern girl in me didn‚Äôt see it [as rape] because sex was not normalized as a child or in the South,‚Äù she added. ‚ÄúAnd, you know what, fuck it, I‚Äôm just gonna say it: My #MeToo story is me telling somebody that someone did this to me, and they never got in trouble for it. They never got taken out of the movie they were in.‚Äù

A year later, Demi opened up further about the alleged incident during an appearance on the Call Her Daddy podcast.

‚ÄúIt was hard because this person was also around. Like, they were also on Disney,‚Äù they said. ‚ÄúAnd so, seeing them around was difficult and it really messed up my teenage years. And finally, I went and got help for that.‚Äù

‚ÄúIt‚Äôs been something that I‚Äôve worked on, but you know, I've had other traumas happen, and it kind of pushes those to the side a little bit, but there are moments where I definitely will cry and just feel the sad,‚Äù they continued.

‚ÄúAnd to be clear, like it wasn't anyone in the immediate Disney circle. I've had people ask questions like, ‚ÄòWas it this person or was it that person?‚Äô And it was like, ‚ÄòI don't think it'd be anybody that anyone would guess, but they were friends with someone on set and they'd come around [all] the time,‚Äô‚Äù she added.

Demi also discussed the subject of body image, claiming that members of her team tightly controlled her food consumption because they wanted her to look ‚Äúthin‚Äù while she was on Disney.

‚ÄúThey didn't let me have phones in my hotel room because they didn't want me to call room service,‚Äù she said. ‚ÄúThey put furniture outside of my [hotel] door, so I couldn't sneak out and eat if I wanted to. It was that level of controlling when it came to my food.‚Äù

‚ÄúFor someone in recovery from an eating disorder, that's so dangerous. It actually exacerbated my eating disorder. I became bulimic again,‚Äù she added, referring to the fact that she first developed an eating disorder at the age of 12.

What‚Äôs more, it was announced last month that Demi is set to chart her experiences even further in a self-directed Hulu documentary about the highs and lows of child stardom that is coming out next year.

So, with all this in mind, many fans theorized that the Disney Channel had purposefully omitted Demi from its montage in light of all she‚Äôs revealed about her experiences while working there.

And this theory seemed even more apparent when several replies under Disney‚Äôs montage referring to Demi‚Äôs claims were hidden, according to Twitter accounts PopCrave and Buzzing Pop.

‚ÄúSay what you want about Demi but you cannot deny the influence she had during her Disney era especially now!!!‚Äù one person wrote. ‚ÄúGive her the respect she deserves.‚Äù

‚Äúthey gave so much to disney channel from As the Bell Rings, Sonny w/ A Chance, Camp Rock, Princess Protection Program, NOT TO MENTION SHE HAD THE BEST VOCALS ON SEND IT ON?!‚Äù added another.

‚ÄúThis is literally so sad #justicefordemi,‚Äù someone wrote, while others labeled Disney ‚Äúdisrespectful‚Äù and slammed their ‚Äúunacceptable behavior.‚Äù
